ARABIC: أَوْ تَقُولَ حِينَ تَرَى ٱلْعَذَابَ لَوْ أَنَّ لِى كَرَّةً فَأَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: or lest he should say, when he sees the punishment, 'If only I could have another chance so that I could be a good-doer!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Or say on seeing the punishment: "If I could only return I would be among the good."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: or lest he should say, when he sees the chastisement: “O that I might return again, and be among those who do good.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Or, on seeing the torment, it would say, "Would I have the opportunity, this time I would certainly become a pious person".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Or (so that no soul) may say when it beholds the punishment, “If only I may be sent back, so that I may do good deeds!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Or (lest) he should say when he sees the torment: "If only I had another chance, then I should indeed be among the doers of good."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Or it should say when it sees the punishment: Were there only a returning for me, I should be of the doers of good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: it should say, when it sees the chastisement, 'O that I might return again, and be among the good-doers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Or should say, when it seeth the doom: Oh, that I had but a second chance that I might be among the righteous!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Or, he may say as he sees the punishment, "Would that I had a second chance, so that I could be among the doers of good."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Or lest it should say, when it will behold the torment: were there for me a return I would be of the well-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Or say, when he sights the punishment, ‘If only there were a second chance for me, I would be among the virtuous!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Or (lest) it should say when it (actually) sees the penalty: 'If only I had another chance, I should certainly be among those who do good!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Or (lest) he should say when he sees the torment: "If only I had another chance (to return to the world) then I should indeed be among the Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Or, lest when it sees the punishment should say: 'O that I might return, and be among those that did good'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Or say, when it sees the penalty, “If only I had another chance, I would be of the virtuous.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Or [lest] it say when it sees the punishment, "If only I had another turn so I could be among the doers of good."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [39:58] or [before] that it should say, when it sees the chastisement, ‘If only there had been a second chance, a return to this world, I would be among the virtuous’, the believers. It is then said to him by God:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Or should say) and so that it will not say, (when it seeth the doom: Oh, that I had but a second chance) to return to the life of this world (that I might be among the righteous) among those who believe in Allah's divine Oneness!
